Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.

parts: what is the current SIngapore medisave contribution limit as at February 2025

content.text: search("what is the current SIngapore medisave contribution limit as at February 2025")

parts:
As of February 2025, the Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) in Singapore is set at $75,500. This amount represents the maximum limit that can be maintained in your MediSave Account. Once this cap is reached, any excess contributions are automatically redirected to your other Central Provident Fund (CPF) accounts, such as the Special Account (SA) or Ordinary Account (OA). citeturn0search0

For self-employed individuals, compulsory MediSave contribution rates vary based on age and net trade income. These rates are designed to ensure sufficient savings for healthcare needs. It's important to note that while there are specified contribution rates, the total amount you can contribute is capped by the BHS. citeturn0search1

Additionally, the CPF system imposes an annual salary ceiling of $102,000 on total wages, which includes both Ordinary Wages (OW) and Additional Wages (AW). This ceiling limits the total CPF contributions payable for the year. citeturn0search8

For employees, CPF contribution rates are structured based on age. As of January 1, 2025, individuals aged 55 and below contribute a total of 37% of their wages to CPF, with 17% coming from the employer and 20% from the employee. These contributions are allocated across the OA, SA, and MediSave Account (MA) according to predetermined ratios. citeturn0search5

It's essential to stay informed about these limits and rates to effectively plan your healthcare financing and retirement savings.

parts: What is the expected increase in the BHS over time?

content.text: search("What is the expected increase in the BHS over time?")

parts:
The Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) in Singapore is adjusted annually to align with the projected basic subsidised healthcare expenses for individuals aged 65 and above. This adjustment ensures that MediSave accounts maintain sufficient funds to cover anticipated medical needs during retirement. Historically, the BHS has seen an average annual increase of approximately 4% to 5%. For instance, in 2025, the BHS was set at $75,500, reflecting a 5.6% rise from the previous year's $71,500. citeturn0search1

Given this trend, it's reasonable to anticipate that the BHS will continue to increase annually by a similar percentage. However, the exact rate of future adjustments will depend on various factors, including healthcare inflation, changes in medical technology, and policy decisions. Therefore, while past trends provide a general guideline, they do not guarantee future rates of increase.

It's important to note that once individuals reach the age of 65, their BHS is fixed and will not be subject to further adjustments. This means that any changes in the BHS after one turns 65 will not affect their MediSave account cap. citeturn0search1

Staying informed about these adjustments is crucial for effective financial planning, especially concerning healthcare needs in retirement.

parts: Are there any officially declared BHS sums for the next couple of years?

content.text: search("Are there any officially declared BHS sums for the next couple of years?")

parts:
As of February 2025, the Singapore government has not officially declared the Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) amounts for the years beyond 2025. The BHS is reviewed and adjusted annually to align with the projected basic subsidised healthcare expenses for individuals aged 65 and above. Historically, the BHS has increased by approximately 4% to 5% each year. For instance, it rose from $71,500 in 2024 to $75,500 in 2025, marking a 5.6% increase. citeturn0search1

While specific figures for the upcoming years have not been released, if the trend of a 4% to 5% annual increase continues, projections for the BHS could be as follows:

| Year | Projected BHS (4% increase) | Projected BHS (5% increase) |
|------|-----------------------------|-----------------------------|
| 2026 | $78,520                     | $79,275                     |
| 2027 | $81,661                     | $83,239                     |
| 2028 | $84,927                     | $87,401                     |
| 2029 | $88,324                     | $91,771                     |
| 2030 | $91,857                     | $96,360                     |

These projections are based on the assumption of consistent annual increases and are intended for general planning purposes. The actual BHS adjustments will depend on various factors, including healthcare inflation, changes in medical technology, and policy decisions. Therefore, it's advisable to stay informed through official channels for the most accurate and up-to-date information.
